t: Psalm 38
Prayer of a Suffering Sinner
A psalm of David to bring remembrance.
Lord,*spn do not punish me in your anger or*ln discipline me in your wrath.
For*ln your arrows have sunk into me, and*ln your hand has pressed down on me.
There*pn is no soundness in my body because*ln of your indignation; there*ln is no health in my bones because*ln of my sin.
For*ln my iniquities have flooded over my head; they*ln are a burden too heavy for me to bear.
My*ln wounds are foul and festering because*ln of my foolishness.
I*ln am bent over and brought very low; all*ln day long I go around in mourning.
For*ln my insides are full of burning pain, and*ln there is no soundness in my body.
I*ln am faint and severely crushed; I*ln groan because of the anguish of my heart.
Lord,*pn my every desire is in front of you; my*ln sighing is not hidden from you.
My*ln heart races, my strength leaves me, and*ln even the light of my eyes has faded.
My*ln loved ones and friends stand back from my affliction, and*ln my relatives stand at a distance.
Those*ln who intend to kill me set traps, and*ln those who want to harm me threaten to destroy me; they*ln plot treachery all day long.
I*pn am like a deaf person; I do not hear. I*ln am like a speechless person who*ln does not open his mouth.
I*ln am like a man who does not hear and*ln has no arguments in his mouth.
For*ln I put my hope in you, Lord;*s you*ln will answer me, my Lord, my God.
For*ln I said, “Don’t let them rejoice over me — those*ln who are arrogant toward me when I stumble.”
For*ln I am about to fall, and*ln my pain is constantly with me.
So*ln I confess my iniquity; I*ln am anxious because of my sin.
But*ln my enemies are vigorous and powerful; many*ln hate me for no reason.
Those*ln who repay evil for good attack*ln me for pursuing good.
Lord,*spn do not abandon me; my*ln God, do not be far from me.
Hurry*ln to help me, my*ln Lord, my salvation.
